column3: @sipa @jonasschnelli This might be of interest to you

Yeah, this instruction is a bit misleading: it's not just enough to download that script, you also have to install OpenTimestamps. The easiest way to do that is simply run:\n\n    pip3 install opentimestamps-client
I'd rather link to the "manual" installation, since it seems common to typosquat package names for pip.
I don't think that's much of a risk, given that we'd be providing copy-n-pastable instructions right there.
